required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Dural Puncture Epidural Technique Versus Conventional Epidural Technique for Adequate Anesthesia During Vaginal Surgeries

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted on 273 patients of ASA grade I and II aged from 25 to 55 years and presented for elective vaginal surgeries such as vaginal hysterectomy, repair of prolapse Patients will be divided into three equal groups; group A control group for conventional epidural technique(n=91), group B for dural puncture epidural with 27G pencil point Whitacre spinal needle (n=91) and group C for dural puncture epidural with 25G pencil point Whitacre spinal needle(n=91). Randomization will be done using computer generated number and concealed using sequentially numbered sealed opaque envelope.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes after local anesthetic injection
primary_outcome.description: Sensory blockade was evaluated using a non-traumatic pinprick stimulus starting at the S2 dermatome and moving in a caudad direction (measured every 2 minutes)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes after local anesthetic injection
Up to 30 minutes after local anesthetic injection

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to achieve the maximum sensory level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes after local anesthetic injection
Up to 30 minutes after local anesthetic injection
Up to 30 minutes after local anesthetic injection
Assessed every 20 minutes after achieving highest dermatome level of sensory analgesia
secondary_outcome.description: Time to two segmental dermatomes regression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed every 20 minutes after achieving Bromage 3 motor block
secondary_outcome.description: Time interval from achievement of Bromage 1 to regression of motor blockade to Bromage 1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time for requirement for rescue analgesia or VAS pain score >3 as postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Time from onset of sensory block to first complain of pain postoperatively as the epidural catheter will be removed after the surgery finished

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Number of extra doses of local anesthetic given after injection of local anesthetic loading dose till end of the surgery
Assessed every 20 minutes during the surgical procedure and postoperatively
Assessed every 5 minutes from the start of anesthetic procedures till transfer the patients to the rooms
During surgical period up to 7 days post-operatively

clinical_study.condition: Gynecologic Disease Requiring Vaginal Operation Under Neuraxial Anesthesia

arm_group.description: Procedure: Standard Lumbar Epidural Block using Touhy Epidural Needle (18G) at L4-5 inter-space and Epidural Catheter (20G) was inserted then bupivacaine 0.5% 15-20 ml with 50ug fentanyl was given.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Dural Puncture Epidural Technique using pencil-point 25G Whitacre needle
arm_group.description: Procedure: 25G Dural Puncture Epidural Block at L4-5 inter-space then bupivacaine 0.5% 15-20 ml with 50ug fentanyl was given.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Dural Puncture Epidural Technique using pencil-point 27G Whitacre needle
arm_group.description: Procedure: 27G Dural Puncture Epidural Block at L4-5 inter-space then bupivacaine 0.5% 15-20 ml with 50ug fentanyl was given.

intervention.description: Standard Lumbar Epidural Technique at L4-5 inter-space using 0.5%Bupivacaine and Fentanyl.
intervention.arm_group_label: Dural Puncture Epidural Technique using pencil-point 25G Whitacre needle
Dural Puncture Epidural Technique using pencil-point 27G Whitacre needle

intervention.description: 25G Dural Puncture Epidural Technique at L4-5 inter-space using 0.5%Bupivacaine and Fentanyl.
intervention.arm_group_label: Dural Puncture Epidural Technique using pencil-point 27G Whitacre needle

intervention.description: 27G Dural Puncture Epidural Technique at L4-5 inter-space using 0.5%Bupivacaine and Fentanyl.
intervention.arm_group_label: Dural Puncture Epidural Technique using pencil-point 25G Whitacre needle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I and II
- Height(150-170 cm)
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient refusal
- hypersensitivity to local anesthetic drugs
- bleeding disorders and coagulopathy(platelets count less than 80000,INR less than 1.5 or therapeutic dose of anticoagulant).

facility.name: Department of Anesthesia, Surgical ICU, and Pain Management

clinical_study.keyword: Neuraxial Technique, Epidural Technique, Dural Puncture Epidural Technique, Gynecologic Disease
